channel.title: Middleware on Cloudflare Docs
channel.description: Recent content in Middleware on Cloudflare Docs

item.title: Redirect
item.description: Redirect requests from one URL to another or from one set of URLs to another set.

item.title: Respond with another site
item.description: Respond to the Worker request with the response from another website (example.com in this example).

item.title: 103 Early Hints
item.description: Allow a client to request static assets while waiting for the HTML response.

item.title: Alter headers
item.description: Example of how to add, change, or delete headers sent in a request or returned in a response.

item.title: Block on TLS
item.description: Inspects the incoming request’s TLS version and blocks if under TLSv1.2.

item.title: Bulk origin override
item.description: Resolve requests to your domain to a set of proxy third-party origin URLs.

item.title: Bulk redirects
item.description: Redirect requests to certain URLs based on a mapped object to the request’s URL.

item.title: Cache POST requests
item.description: Cache POST requests using the Cache API.

item.title: Cache using fetch
item.description: Determine how to cache a resource by setting TTLs, custom cache keys, and cache headers in a fetch request.

item.title: Conditional response
item.description: Return a response based on the incoming request’s URL, HTTP method, User Agent, IP address, ASN or device type.

item.title: Modify request property
item.description: Create a modified request with edited properties based off of an incoming request.

item.title: Modify response
item.description: Fetch and modify response properties which are immutable by creating a copy first.

item.title: Multiple Cron Triggers
item.description: Set multiple Cron Triggers on three different schedules.

item.title: Set security headers
item.description: Set common security headers (X-XSS-Protection, X-Frame-Options, X-Content-Type-Options, Permissions-Policy, Referrer-Policy, Strict-Transport-Security, Content-Security-Policy).

item.title: Setting Cron Triggers
item.description: Set a Cron Trigger for your Worker.

item.title: Using the Cache API
item.description: Use the Cache API to store responses in Cloudflare’s cache.
